snippet: British schools now do a better job of lifting students up the social ladder, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said in a report published Tuesday.
abstract: Report published by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development indicates that British educational institutions are more successful than American schools at helping students achieve upward social mobility.
lead_paragraph: British schools now do a better job of lifting students up the social ladder, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said in a report published Tuesday.

headline.main: Britain: British Schools Offer More Upward Mobility for Students Than American Ones, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Britain: British Schools Offer More Upward Mobility For Students Than American Ones, New Report Says

keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
keywords.name: organizations
